Line1.B2A6B: For forty-three years, I have swept the floors, lit the candles, and welcomed the faithful here to the tomb of our Saint Ilenora. May she rest in the Father’s glory.
Line3.B2A6B: But the faithful have stopped coming. I hear their horses thunder by on the road to Scosglen,  charging headlong into the wild to serve the Father.
Line5.B2A6B: The lucky few may earn a tomb of their own … and perhaps an old monk to care for them while the world forgets their names.
VoiceDir5.B2A6B: Weary. Resigned. A joke on his own foolishness.
